name: IAM Troubleshooter.txt - Problem
description: This section explains that the IAM Troubleshooter is an automated process designed to check and troubleshoot issues related to Identity and Access Management (IAM) in a Kubernetes cluster. It runs various checks on a given cluster, namespace, and deployment to identify and resolve potential IAM-related problems. The IAM Troubleshooter is currently deployed as part of a system called JARVIS.
use_cases: Troubleshooting IAM-related issues in a Kubernetes cluster
Identifying and resolving potential IAM problems in a specific namespace or deployment
Integrating IAM troubleshooting capabilities into a larger system (JARVIS)

name: IAM Troubleshooter.txt - Solution
description: This section outlines the key steps to troubleshoot authentication issues when accessing AWS resources from a deployment. It involves verifying the presence of an authentication method (Service account or KIAM), checking if the associated IAM role exists, ensuring the role's assume role policy or OIDC URL is correct, and confirming the KIAM pods are running (if using KIAM).
use_cases: Troubleshooting authentication issues when accessing AWS resources from a deployment
Verifying the authentication method used in a deployment (Service account or KIAM)
Checking the existence and configuration of the associated IAM role
Confirming the KIAM pods are running (if using KIAM)
capabilities: IAM role assume role policy validation

name: IAM Troubleshooter.txt - 4. Whether the KIAM pods are running or not (In case of KIAM)
description: This section provides a visual guide to check if the KIAM (Kubernetes IAM Authenticator) pods are running or not. KIAM is a tool that allows Kubernetes pods to securely retrieve AWS credentials from the AWS metadata service. By checking if the KIAM pods are running, users can ensure that their Kubernetes cluster is properly configured to authenticate with AWS and access AWS resources.
use_cases: Troubleshooting authentication issues between Kubernetes and AWS
Verifying the proper setup and configuration of KIAM in a Kubernetes cluster
Monitoring the health and status of KIAM pods in a Kubernetes environment
capabilities: Visual representation of KIAM pod status
Identifying running or non-running KIAM pods
Troubleshooting KIAM-related issues in Kubernetes clusters
